verbose_text: Optical imaging using the CatB680 probe during acute TNCB induced cutaneous DTHR revealed a tendency towards increased signal intensity in the inflamed right ears of Ctsb -/- mice compared with that in wild-type mice, suggesting compensatory effects of other proteases, especially since fluorescence microscopy analysis as well as Western blot analysis for cathepsin B expression showed cathepsin B deficiency in the inflamed ears of Ctsb -/- mice.
